title: Ticket #7200: GPU Memory Post-Mortems
description:
LIGO is moving forward with running multiple jobs per GPU, but this opens up the possibility of one job catastrophically interfering with the other by over-allocating the GPU's memory. There does not appear to be a way to prevent this on pre-Volta hardware, but if HTCondor could reliably determine which job caused the problem, or even just what the pre-catastrophe memory usage had been, that would allow mistakes to be corrected.

It seems reasonable to assume that this will require per-job GPU (memory) usage attribution; this ticket is therefore a child of #7199. Depending on how that ticket progresses, and/or other real-world issues, it is possible that this ticket will result in more a crime-scene investigation report than an indictment.
